required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Single-cycle Remote Ischemic Preconditioning and Postconditioning for Prevention of Contrast-Induced Nephropathy (SCRIP-CIN) Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Single-cycle Remote Ischemic Pre/Post-conditioning, for Prevention of Contrast-induced Acute Kidney Injury in Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease Undergoing Coronary Angiography or Coronary Angioplasty at Phramongkutklao Hospital and Thammasat Hospital

lead_sponsor.agency: Phramongkutklao College of Medicine and Hospital

clinical_study.source: Phramongkutklao College of Medicine and Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is a 2 x 2 factorial design, double-blinded, randomized controlled trial to evaluate efficacy and safety of remote ischemic preconditioning and postconditioning for prevention of contrast-induced acute kidney injury in patient undergoing coronary angiography and angioplasty

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of CI-AKI, which was defined as an increment of serum creatinine 0.5 mg/dL or a relative increase of 25% over the baseline value
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within a period of 24 hours after contrast medium administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in sCr and eGFR from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a period of 24 hours after contrast medium administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Major adverse cerebrovascular and cardiovascular events (MACCE) in each intervention group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a period of 6 months after contrast medium administration
secondary_outcome.description: MACCE were composite of death, hospitalization, acute coronary syndrome, congestive heart failure and stroke or transient ischemic attack

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence(%) of CI-AKI in differrent subgroups of patient characteristics
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a period of 24 hours after contrast medium administration
secondary_outcome.description: Patient characteristics include eGFR, global CIAKI risk score, contrast media volume and DM. Incidence of CI-AKI, which was defined as an increment of serum creatinine 0.5 mg/dL or a relative increase of 25% over the baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence(%) of CI-AKI in patients with vs without RIPre and RIPost
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a period of 24 hours after contrast medium administration
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of CI-AKI, which was defined as an increment of serum creatinine 0.5 mg/dL or a relative increase of 25% over the baseline value

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence(%) of MACCE in differrent subgroups of patient characteristics
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a period of 6 months after contrast medium administration
secondary_outcome.description: Patient characteristics include eGFR, global CIAKI risk score, contrast media volume and DM. MACCE were composite of death, hospitalization, acute coronary syndrome, congestive heart failure and stroke or transient ischemic attack

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence(%) of MACCE in patients with vs without RIPre and RIPost
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a period of 6 months after contrast medium administration
secondary_outcome.description: Patient characteristics include eGFR, global CIAKI risk score, contrast media volume and DM. MACCE were composite of death, hospitalization, acute coronary syndrome, congestive heart failure and stroke or transient ischemic attack

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence(%) of MACCE in patients who have CI-AKI vs patients who have no CI-AKI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a period of 6 months after contrast medium administration
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of CI-AKI, which was defined as an increment of serum creatinine 0.5 mg/dL or a relative increase of 25% over the baseline value within a period of 24 hours after contrast medium administration

intervention.description: Preconditioning 200 mmHg x 5 minutes before procedure
Postconditioning 200 mmHg x 5 minutes after procedure
Sham 10 mmHg x 5 minutes before procedure
Sham 10 mmHg x 5 minutes after procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The patient have indication for coronary angiography or angioplasty.
- Impaired renal function with reduced eGFR < 60 ml/min/1.73 m2 by CKD-EPI equation.
- Written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of contrast allergy.
- The patient had end-stage renal failure with the need for hemodialysis.
- The patient take medications that affect the kidneys function within 48 hours before study.
- The patient had acute kidney injury from any cause.
- The patient was received contrast media within 2 weeks before study.
- The patient had cardiac arrest or shock.
- The patient had peripheral arterial disease (PAD)
- Pregnancy
- Refused to study

overall_official.affiliation: Phramongkutklao College of Medicine and Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Phramongkutklao College of Medicine and Hospital
responsible_party.investigator_title: Phramongkutklao College of Medicine and Hospital
